label.INDSFGA: Gap between percentage of babies found to be small for gestational age for those living in the most and least deprived areas

result.label: Indicator - Small for gestational age
result.note:
[b]Small for gestational age[/b]

[b]How do we measure this?[/b]
The gap in percentage points between babies born in the most and least deprived areas, who are small for gestational age. For this indicator a lower figure is better.

[b]Source[/b]
Northern Ireland Maternity System, Department of Health
[url=https://www.health-ni.gov.uk/articles/health-inequalities-statistics]www.health-ni.gov.uk/articles/health-inequalities-statistics[/url]

[b]Impact of Covid-19
[/b]The information needed to report on this indicator was collected as normal during Covid-19.[b]

Further information[/b]
1. Absolute gap in percentage points (as opposed to relative proportionate gap) was used for calculations.
2. Small for gestational age refers to any live birth with a birth weight falling below the 10th percentile.
3. Deprivation quintiles were defined according to the 2017 NIMDM.
4. For more information on this data please contact the data provider - [url=mailto:healthinequalities@health-ni.gov.uk]Public Health Information & Research Branch, Information Analysis Directorate, DOH[/url] or see the '[url=https://www.health-ni.gov.uk/articles/health-inequalities-statistics]Health Inequalities Annual Report[/url]'.
